title: Drawing, "Designs for Wallpaper and Textiles: Flowers", 19th century
medium: Brush and gouache, graphite on brown paper
markings: Stamped in black ink top of center in composition: an oval shaped seal with an interlocked CG in the center. Written around the seal: 31 Boulevard Nouvelles
inscribed: Inscribed in graphite, upper right: B64.
description: Horizontally-oriented diamond shape filled in with flowers and foliage. Five plants form a backwords S-shape laid horizontally. From left: first brown stem with four yellow tufts dangling from three ends. Two with tops to the left, one facing right. Second: brown stem with green foliage and maroon blooms facing downward. Third: two branches once facing up and one down with green foliage and clusters of green berries. Fourth: brown branch with white and yellow tufts facing downward. Fifth: placed above the rest of the composition with three light brown stems and green foliage. Guidelines in graphite are visible with the diamond bisected horizontally and vertically. On green-brown ground.

tombstone.epitaph: Drawing, "Designs for Wallpaper and Textiles: Flowers", 19th century. Brush and gouache, graphite on brown paper. Gift of Harvey Smith. 1968-107-62.
